article_title: Expert: Consolidations, mergers driving up health care prices
article_text:
Expert: Consolidations, mergers driving up health care prices

The trend of consolidations, mergers and acquisitions among medical providers is continuing to drive up health care prices without providing any additional benefits to consumers, a health policy expert told a Trinity University audience Tuesday.

article_metadata.description: The trend of consolidations, mergers and acquisitions among medical providers is continuing to drive up health care prices without providing any additional benefits to consumers, a health policy expert told a Trinity University audience Tuesday.  Paul Hughes-Cromwich, a senior health economist at Altarum Institute’s Center for Sustainable Health Spending, said the federal health care reform law includes several cost-saving measures, such as penalties for hospitals with excessive patient readmissions within a month of release.  Dudensing said while more Texans became covered by health insurance under the Affordable Care Act and tax credits dramatically lowered the costs for many, the federal law actually imposed new taxes — such as the health insurance tax — that added to health care costs.
article_metadata.author.name: By Peggy O'Hare, Staff Writer

og.description: The trend of consolidations, mergers and acquisitions among medical providers is continuing to drive up health care prices without providing any additional benefits to consumers, a health policy expert told a Trinity University audience Tuesday.  Paul Hughes-Cromwich, a senior health economist at Altarum Institute’s Center for Sustainable Health Spending, said the federal health care reform law includes several cost-saving measures, such as penalties for hospitals with excessive patient readmissions within a month of release.  Dudensing said while more Texans became covered by health insurance under the Affordable Care Act and tax credits dramatically lowered the costs for many, the federal law actually imposed new taxes — such as the health insurance tax — that added to health care costs.
og.title: Expert: Consolidations, mergers driving up health care prices
